io.spine.testing.logging

Class Interceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.testing.logging.Interceptor

  • public final class Interceptor
extends java.lang.Object
    Intercepts logging records of the associated class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interceptor(java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass, java.util.logging.Level level)
      Creates a new instance for intercepting logging of the passed class at the specified minimum level.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LoggingAssertions assertLog()
      Obtains assertions for the accumulated log.
      void intercept()
      Installs the handler for intercepting the records.
      java.util.logging.Level level()
      Obtains the level of logging assigned for the tests.
      java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass()
      Obtains the class which logging operations are tested.
      java.util.logging.Level previousLevel()
      Obtains the level of the logging set for the logging class before the tests.
      void release()
      Returns the logger configuration to the previous state.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interceptor

        public Interceptor(java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass,
                   java.util.logging.Level level)
        Creates a new instance for intercepting logging of the passed class at the specified minimum level.

    • Method Detail

      • intercept

        public void intercept()
        Installs the handler for intercepting the records.

        Current handlers are removed and remembered. The logger will also not use parent handlers.

        See Also:
        release()

      • release

        public void release()
        Returns the logger configuration to the previous state.

      • assertLog

        public LoggingAssertions assertLog()
        Obtains assertions for the accumulated log.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the interceptor is not yet installed or already released
        See Also:
        intercept(), release()

      • loggingClass

        public java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass()
        Obtains the class which logging operations are tested.

      • level

        public java.util.logging.Level level()
        Obtains the level of logging assigned for the tests.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the interceptor is not yet installed or already released

      • previousLevel

        public java.util.logging.Level previousLevel()
        Obtains the level of the logging set for the logging class before the tests.
